page.title: 05Government in Cheddleton
page.content: Cheddleton Parish Council was formed in 1894 and since then 150 men and 9 women have served the village. Cheddleton P.C. is one of the local councils in Staffordshire Moorlands District Council. Chairman Mr. Brian Forrester, Clerk Mr. J. Simcock. There are 17 members, of whom 4 are women, and they are elected for 4 years. Meetings are held alternately at St. Andrews Church,Cheddleton, and the village hall, Wetley Rocks. On 15 April 1946, Miss Annie Barber was elected first lady member of the council, and in 1951 the first lady Chairman of Cheddleton Parish Council.
